results.title: Water: a first film
results.creator_credit: Arthur D. Nelles and Film Associates
results.brief_description:
Designed to increase the young child’s understanding of the importance of water to the planet Earth. Concepts of the uses and misuses of water are also highlighted.
Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Water, water, everywhere
results.creator_credit: Marc Beaudet, ONF | NFB and Gilles Blais
results.brief_description: An underwater close up of the death of a trout in polluted water. A film for conservationists and all people concerned about the preservation of the natural world and the creatures that inhabit it.

results.title: Water skiing
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, Rob McAuley and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines basic courtesies and safety rules and procedures of the sport. Cast includes Bronwyn Wright, Robbie Woods. Commentary by Ken Warby.

results.title: Water service
results.creator_credit: C A Radley, Selwyn Films and David MacKane
results.brief_description: How water is carried from lakes and streams to the reservoirs where it is put through filter beds to be purified, before being piped from power-houses to the consumers. Samples of water are continually being tested for contamination and impurities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: C A Radley, Selwyn Films and David MacKane

results.title: Water says
results.brief_description: Clouds of early morning mist roll back revealing dew laden plants. A stream ripples down the mountain, bubbling around stones and cascading down the slope. It widens and flows gently on until it reaches the unpredictable sea. Accompanied by water sounds and appropriate background music. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Water safety: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Michael Delean and Associates and Michael Delean
results.brief_description: Water accidents can be prevented if you know which situations spell danger. But if you find yourself or someone else in trouble in the water, there are specific techniques which can save lives or buy time until help arrives. Here are illustrated a variety of ways to avoid water accidents, the right and wrong ways of helping yourself or someone else in trouble, and survival floating techniques.

results.title: Water safety
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Although our main beaches are well patrolled by lifesavers, it is in the rivers and creeks, where we must rely on ourselves, that many drownings occur. The film shows many ways in which we can help ourselves in an emergency and suggests precautions to take before swimming in unknown places. Commentary by David Low.

results.title: Water safety
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Bill Latto
results.brief_description: An appreciation of the factors affecting the safety of those people who enjoy recreation both in and on the water. Shows a senior service safety patrol boat in action. The lifeguard carries out mouth-to-mouth resucitation; a swimming instructor teaches life saving methods. Considers the care and maintenance of craft, rescue techniques, and wearing of life jackets when boating.

results.title: Water runs downhill: observation and inference
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath, Journal Films and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science fact and fun”.
A number of observations concerning water are made, and from these inferences are drawn about water and gravity and the part they play in eroding and shaping the earth. Suitable for upper primary level.
